fields.description: Specifically, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#codedeploy_region
fields.summary: Update AWS CodeDeploy add-on regions (BBCDEV-2591)

fields.description: Currently, there is a hard limit per container of 2GB.
fields.summary: Allow for more than 2GB of memory per container.

fields.description: Users would like to be able to add an SSH key to their Bitbucket account with version 2 of our API.
fields.summary: Give users the ability to add SSH keys to their account via API 2 - Customer request

fields.description:
Bitbucket now opens to an arguably useless "overview" tab.

Would LOVE any of the following

a) Add a search box (like the one in "repositories" tab) in the overview tab.\\
or\\
b) Have bitbucket open on the "repositories" tab\\
or\\
c) Have bitbucket remember/return to the last selected tab.

We are a fast and furious team - often have to touch/view a dozen apps per day.  The extra click is very annoying.
fields.summary: Search box on the main page

fields.description:
*Given* that I am a developer of a project

*When* I specify a custom file filter on the project's settings

*Then* when I see a pull request all files matching that filter should be hidden from view (though I should see a small notification of the number of files hidden by the filter)

This is helpful for projects that check in folders like node_modules, which have a TON of files and are generally related to third party code. Standard answer is "dont check in node_modules" but there are occasionally good, practical reasons to do so, and I'd like a way to hide these from diffs on a project to project basis.
fields.summary: Ability to filter files from showing up on pull request diffs per project

fields.description:
Add ability to tag, group and archive (hide) repositories.

I suggest the following model, its a bit like gmail.

A button next to each repository to archive that repository. Once archived it does not appear on the main page, or in the drop down menu in the navigation header.

A button should be placed somewhere on the main page named "Archived", which when clicked brings up all archived repositories.

The main purpose the archive feature serves, is hiding it from the main page.

Now on to grouping/tagging.

Firstly, we should be able to create our own tags. Next, A button should exist for each tag created, when clicked, it should show all repositories (either archived or active) with the selected tag.

Tagging serves two purposes, to label a repository and a way for grouping repositories with the same tags.

For example:

!3659553512-upload.png|thumbnail!

Similar to BCLOUD-894
fields.summary: Repository Organisation

fields.description:
Sometimes you don't realize that after code review someone pushed another commit to a pull-request. Those commits are usually named "fixup! …" to allow auto-squashing on rebase operations.

If you don't realize that, you end up with a Fixup-Commit in your master branch.

I'd suggest a simple warning popup if you're about to merge a branch/pull-request that contains commits starting with "fixup! …"
fields.summary: Warning when about to merge a "fixup!" commit

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to push back to the repository, maybe that's already possible but I tried some tricks and none of them worked. {{git push origin}} just gives an authentication failed error.

The use case we have is that we do deployment if a build is successful on the master branch (Tests pass, lints pass etc). Once the deployment is done we want it to tag the version with a tag to mark it as deployed, that way everyone knows exactly what commit is in what environment.
fields.summary: Push back to remote from Pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a repo is transferred to a new owner in Bitbucket, the corresponding change is not automatically made in the CodeDeploy add-on database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure CodeDeploy add-on for a repo
# Transfer the repo from one Bitbucket account to a different one

h3. Expected Results
CodeDeploy add-on continues to work

h3. Actual Results
Deployments fail and configuring the add-on also fails

h3. Workaround
Contact [Bitbucket Support|https://id.atlassian.com/login%3Fapplication%3Dsac%26continue%3Dhttps://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11]  so a developer can manually fix the issue for the specific repo
fields.summary: Transferring ownership of a repo breaks CodeDeploy add-on
Allow sorting tags by semantic version number
How about removing old lines of logs when it becomes too big?

fields.description:
Would be great to have build wall support like Bamboo. https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/displaying-the-wallboard-289276971.html

Much like many of the other requests in this tracker, a central way at the least to check on build status and get status. Currently it takes a fair amount of effort to get build status. Most CIs offer a plethora of ways you can either hook into or glance at status. We have used Wallboard for most of our projects, it would be great to have a feature like this offered as Pipelines has significantly less configuration and setup than Bamboo. Great work so far guys!
fields.summary: Build Wallboard Support for Pipelines

fields.description: At the moment it is impossible to build the project, if there is a file uploaded via Git LFS.
fields.summary: Support Git LFS in the Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description: This seems to be the only thing that is done better in GitHub wikis. There, if you hover over a header in a wiki, there a paragraph character shows up, and if you click on the header, it updates the URL so that it is possible to send someone a link directly to a sub-section of a wiki page. In Bitbucket, we currently have to open the developer tools inspector, find the appropriate #markdown-header-something anchor, and copy-and-paste that into the URL.
fields.summary: Allow linking to wiki page subsections by making headers link to the appropriate #markdown-header anchor

fields.description:
In one of my wiki pages, I was hoping to output a double tilde ("~") character to describe how to add strikethrough markdown and realize I am not able to escape a single or double tilde character. For instances, I wanted to create an issue template at the top of the issue page and I had the following text:

bq. ## Remaining tasks

* **

# Sample unfinished task
# Another sample unfinished task
# *Sample on hold task [onhold]*
# -~~Sample finished task [done]~~-


Here's the raw markdown

{code}
## Remaining tasks  
  
1. Sample unfinished task  
1. Another sample unfinished task  
1. \*Sample on hold task [onhold]\*  
1. ~~~~Sample finished task [done]~~~~  
{code}

For the last "finished" task, notice how it only works if I use 4 tilde characters in a row. It seems to work fine, except I was hoping to not have the text styled. Currently this is not possible, because if I add the escaped character (i.e. {{\~~Sample finished task [done]\~~}}), it shows the backslash. Is there any workaround?

I verified with the documentation that the tilde character is not a something you can escape:

[Backslash escapes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH035/Markdown%2Bsyntax%2Bguide#Markdownsyntaxguide-Backslashescapes]

This may be an outlier request, but still useful to be consistent throughout your documentation. That is why I categorized this issue as a bug vs enhancement/proposal.
fields.summary: Cannot escape the "tilde" character

fields.description: When we send a commit notification e-mail, we only show the commits that were made. It would be useful to also show which branch these commits are on.
fields.summary: Show branch name in commit e-mail
Fix documentation on commit messages with Windows

Hello,\\
I have a private repo with different branches and one of the branch is features. I am able to create the branch but when i push something. it will not allow me. I am attaching the screenshot of the problem.

Thanks

fields.description:
h1. Current Status

We are kicking off this project in the next few weeks and will provide updates here regarding our status as we move along. Our current plan is to implement Project Settings first followed by Project Permissions once the technical details have been ironed out.

You can also refer to our public roadmap here: [https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?selectedProduct=bitbucket]
----
h3. Problem Definition

Users can only modify repositories' access in repository level although it's grouped under the same project.
h3. Suggested Resolution

It will be best that Bitbucket Cloud can include [Project Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Using%2Bproject%2Bpermissions].
 This will allow users to manage all the repositories under a project easily.
fields.summary: Allow user to manage repositories access with Project Permissions

So, some developer mistook pipeline to re-run, then the enviroment degraded.

fields.description:
Currently there is no where to review pipeline usage and there are set limits.

We want to move from Bamboo Cloud to Pipelines, but concern is that we're currently estimated to use 3000 minutes / month building but only have team of 4 which allows for 1200 / minutes.

We want to track what is being used to ensure if we do move that we can contain our usage and see how it's calculated.
fields.summary: Somewhere to review pipeline usage

fields.description:
Currently there doesn't appear to be any way to stop a build except manually if the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file is included in the source.

Could do with a way to stop, perhaps with a comment in commit.
fields.summary: Ability to not build on commit to branches without removing bitbucket-pipelines.yml from source

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is hard to write simple documents (formatted a little better than just plain text) which content can be version controlled and rendered in the bitbucket repo browser.\\
Below are the feedback based on customer's experience:

* Markdown is not good enough, e.g. to easy to make mistakes that do not render properly. (E.g. that an empty white line is needed between a paragraph and a bullet item).
* It's fragile to maintain user's local render system and to make it render the same way the bitbucket repo browser renders things.

h3. Suggested Solution
Emacs' has had the "org-mode" for quite some time and works beatifully.\\
It will be great that Bitbucket Cloud will support it
fields.summary: Customer Request: Support for Emacs' org-mode format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Import repository feature in Bitbucket Cloud is not sufficient when there're hundreds of repositories need to migrate to Bitbucket Cloud.
 And there's no tool that allows users to migrate their repositories from Bitbucket Server to Bitbucket Cloud easily.

The same can be said regarding the user management, as it is necessary to re-invite the users from Bitbucket Server to Cloud, one-by-one
h3. Suggested Solution

To have a migration tool that allows user to migrate all their repositories, groups and users easily from one server to Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: Customer Request: Repositories migration tool from Bitbucket Server to Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Hello,

We're using the Readme.md (Markdown) to document our project. Part of the documentation uses ASCII drawing which is not rendered 100% correct for two reasons:

h3. Line Spacing
On A PC Chrome Browser or in a Chrome running on Android Devices the line spacing is set to be 1.4 - Although that might look nice, this is not the best for "monospace" or "<pre>" blocks where we normally expect to be 1x1 character.

*Example:*

{code}
#!
       ┌─┐
       │o│
       │o│
       │o│
       └─┘
{code}

As you can see above the "image supposed to be a closed box, but there are gaps between the lines.

h3. Character Spacing on Mobile Device
Opening the same blocks on an Android Device, using Chrome (sorry I don't have IPhone to test from it), there's also other issue, where the whole character space gets corrupted. I've attached two screenshots, showing the PC (Windows + Chrome) and the Android version of the same page:

!669096494-BitBucketMobilePC.png|thumbnail!

!327763759-BitBucketMobileAndroid.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Character and Line spacing on Readme Markdown code block issue - specially when accessing from Mobile Devices

_Steps to Reproduce_

# Go to account settings > OAuth

_Actual Results_

The list flickers with two copies of the deleted OAuth consumer, and then renders with the consumer present once. When refreshing, the consumer is not present.

At this point, deleting the OAuth consumer again results in the list refreshing with the OAuth consumer present twice. A JavaScript error ({{the server responded with a status of 404}}) is displayed in the console. The _Delete_ action on the consumers no longer works.

Also consider: When clicking "Delete" on OAuth Consumers page, '#delete" is added to URL

fields.description:
When you select 'close branch after the pull request is merged' and the merge the pull request the reflog is not being cleaned up. This means that any future branches with that name as path prefix cannot be successfully pushed to due to a git error.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a branch from master called "foo"
# Create a commit on foo and push it to Bitbucket
# Create a PR from foo to master, selecting close branch after merge
# Merge the PR
# Create a branch locally called "foo/my-new-branch-name"
# Attempt to push a commit to "foo/my-new-branch-name" on bitbucket

You will see an error from git that looks something like\\
{{error: unable to create directory for ./logs/refs/heads/foo/my-new-branch-name}}
fields.summary: Closing a branch upon merging a Pull Request is not cleaning up the reflog

fields.description:
{code}
In [3]: cs = r.lookup('7f448db208471e2ed562532821494703e31bdb04')
In [5]: with cs.previewmerge(cs, 'sadfads', 'asdf <asdf@asf.sadf>') as m:
    print m
<GitChangeset 7f448db20847>
{code}

Merge-previewing a commit with itself causes {{fetchandmerge()}} to return as the new merge commit the one that was provided as input. This in turn means that when Bitbucket then calls {{diff()}} and {{patch()}} on it, it shows the diff against its parent, instead of an expected empty diff.

This happens because fetchandmerge shells out to git telling it to merge the current commit with itself. It detects that, prints "Already up-to-date." and exists with a 0 status code. Orochi, not seeing and error, interprets this as a successful merge, looking up the new HEAD and returning it as the merge commit.

Expected: we should either not support merging a commit with itself; raise an exception and make it the caller's problem, or we should do what the caller asks and explicitly create an empty merge commit (recommended).
fields.summary: Orochi's Git merge preview fails to merge commits with themselves

After typing '***:***' to add emoji on a previous PR version comment dialog, PR dialog disappear.\\

###Steps to Reproduce

###Expected Results\\

###Actual Results\\
Able to insert Emoji to the comment dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After clicking _next_ on commit page to the commits with more than 19 opened branches, the commit graph will not align to respective commits.\\
!219030881-CommitGraph.gif|thumbnail!

If load the page by specifying the page number on the link, it able to see the commit graph.\\
Sample link: https://bitbucket.org/<UserName>/<RepoName>/commits/all?page=<PageNumber>

!3278194149-Actual%20view1.PNG|thumbnail!

###Steps to Reproduce

# Open more than 19 branch
# Create commit on each branch that would allow commit graph to stack 20 branches and above
# Navigate to _Commit_ Page
# Click 'Next'/'Previous' to view the commit

###Expected Results\\
Commit graph not aligned to commits

###Actual Results\\
Commit graph should be aligned to each commit in the page

###Workaround\\
Reload the page with the next page number.\\
Example:\\
Current page link:\\
https://bitbucket.org/<UserName>/<RepoName>/commits/all?page=2\\
Reload with the next page number\\
https://bitbucket.org/<UserName>/<RepoName>/commits/all?page=3
fields.summary: Commit graph not aligned to commits when there is more than 19 opened branches

We should probably handle it more gracefully.

I've attached the file I used to cause the error.
fields.summary: Uploading a file with a filename greater than 255 characters to Downloads causes a 500

fields.description: Entering any arbitrary Unicode character on Linux is accomplished via pressing Ctrl+U (Ctrl+Shift+u), which enters unicode input mode. You can then enter the hex representation of the unicode codepoint, and press enter to insert the chosen unicode character. Eg. pressing Ctrl+U, entering {{2014', and pressing enter inserts an em-dash (}}—'). On most editors this works well (including this feedback text box), but when creating a snippet with markdown formatting (I did not test if this happens with plaintext or if it's something to do with the code formatting), it actually inserts the "Enter" keypress and returns a line before entering the character, which is unexpected behavior.
fields.summary: Entering Unicode characters on Linux broken

fields.description: If a divergent rename, file/directory, and directory/file conflict all happen simultaneously with the same path names, the current code will not be able to handle it. For example, if I rename A to B and add a directory named C in one branch, and then in another branch, rename A to C and add a directory named B. Git will report it as a divergent rename and leave it in a weird state. This is similar to the bug fixed in this PR: https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/orochi/pull-request/16/bbs-18655-fix-misreported-divergent-rename
fields.summary: Divergent rename + file/directory conflict doesn't work

https://bitbucket.org/gluent/offload/issues/25/implement-option-to-preserve-load-table\\
https://bitbucket.org/gluent/offload/commits/ca69d182c939

In this scenario, Martin Nash committed and pushed the changes, while the issue is labeled as being closed by Paul Bridger.
fields.summary: Issue hook fires with incorrect user when using Mercurial

Redirect to https://www.atlassian.com/end-user-agreement?utm_source=bitbucket&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=footer and returns Error _404 Sorry, the page you're looking for cannot be found_

fields.description: This would provide additional control over build flow.
fields.summary: Add the commit message as an environment variable

fields.description:
As of now, it is too easy to delete things. Accounts/Repos etc can be deleted in a matter of seconds with one or two button clicks.

An improvement would be requiring the user to type a short sentence followed by a button click to confirm deletion... A bit like github.

For example, to delete an account, the user could be asked to type "delete my account" followed by a button click. Or to delete a repo, the user could be asked to enter the repos name followed by a button click.

This would safeguard against accidental deletion and would make it slightly more difficult to delete things.
fields.summary: Too easy to delete things

fields.description:
I try different methods and ends up thinking that private subrepo as well as subrepo aren't well support:

* subpaths aren't use for translating subrepo alias, creating bad paths if you used the recommend way of using relative subrepo.
* even when using absolute url for subrepo, private subrepo, even personal one, aren't authenticate properly.  The url is used without the x-auth-token.

Contrarely to git submodule which aren't fetch on cloning, hg subrepo are fetch on cloning, so before the bitbucket-pipeline is done.  So, it's not possible to set up the ssh keys before hand.

I'm not sure if there is a good solution for this other than allowing to use deploy key from other repository and cloning using ssh instead of https.
fields.summary: Support for private subrepo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a repo admin wants to see which of their repos have webhooks configured, they need to go to the settings of each repo. Users would like to see that at a glance, without having to check each repo.

h3. Suggested Solution
One suggestion that has been made is to add an indication about this in the Dashboard, in the overview of the repositories. E.g. with an extra column that indicates whether a repo has a webhook configured or not.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to see which repos have webhooks configured

fields.description:
The workflow for environment variables is a little strange.

If I try to define the environment variables before creating the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, I get an error:\\
You need to enable Pipelines for this repository to add Environment variables

But if I create the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file before, and reference an environment variable, I'll get an error because it doesn't exist yet and the build will probably fail. I got this error, but it could really be anything caused by a blank variable:\\
Runtime exception: Invalid email provided for docker login.

So this kind of seems like a chicken and egg problem: I need the variables to create the yml file but I also need the yml file to create the variables.

There is a workaround, which is creating a blank bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, then adding the variables, then editing the yml. But this is bad because I'll always have a first build that doesn't represent my code.
fields.summary: Allow environment variable definition before creating bitbucket-pipelines.yml
Commit search: a parameter to automatically redirect the user to the first found commit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Renaming jpg files in Bitbucket UI breaks the image preview in Bitbucket

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new repo
# Clone the repo
# Add a .jpg file, commit and push it to Bitbucket
# Open the repo in Bitbucket UI, specifically the Source page
# Open the .jpg file, and from the top right corner select arrow >> Rename
# Change the extension of the file to .jpg.bump and commit the file
# Open the file again from the Source page of the repo
# Go to arrow >> Rename and change the extension back to .jpg, and commit

h3. Expected Results
In this third commit, the image preview shows normally

h3. Actual Results
In this third commit, the image preview is broken
fields.summary: Renaming jpg files via Bitbucket UI breaks the image preview in Bitbucket (BB-16205)

fields.description:
Customer request:

bq. Every time when I need to add a repository to Bitbucket - once the repository is created, > we follow the instructions to submit an application from scratch.\\
This is fine for adding the contributors file. I then searched the internet to work out how > to add all the other files and then commit them.

Please just add these commands to the guide to help me and others save time and\\
effort searching the internet.\\
i.e. add\\
git commit -m 'Initial commit'\\
$ git push origin master

The other point is that in the Git CMD window the single quote has to be replaced with a > double quote to work.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Improve initial commit guide to also help users work out how to add all the other files and commit.
Impossible to render   in table cells

fields.description:
We use Bitbucket Server an Jenkins and have set the option "Requires a minimum number of successful builds"\\
However if one PR is merged (and the target changes) it is possible to merge more PullRequests without building against that changed target if you manage to be fast enough before the next build is started and Bitbucket shows that a build is in progress.

Is there a way around it?
fields.summary: PR - no of succesfull builds not bulletproof

fields.description:
Currently, Pipelines fails when it is applied to a Mercurial repo that depends on subrepos which are cloned over SSH.

h3. Details
I have a simple Mecurial repository A that relies on Mercurial repository B. A contains a {{.hgsub}} file with a line on the following form:

{code}
B = ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/karltk/B
{code}

When using Pipelines to build repo A, the build stops on checkout, complaining about {{ssh}} not being found:

{code}

+ hg clone -r "42e8c457a6cabf66c55b8e9a864620903d46ddf1" https://x-token-auth:$AUTH_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/karltk/A .
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 5 changesets with 7 changes to 4 files
updating to branch default
remote: /bin/sh: 
remote: ssh: not found
remote: 
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!
{code}

The {{atlassian/agent-setup-hg:latest}} image appears to contain the machinery used for the checkout/cloning stage. As you appear to only clone Mercurial repos over HTTPS, the "missing" {{ssh}} isn't really a surprise...

h3. Solutions
Pipelines appears to be very much tied to Bitbucket, so don't expect you to fetch "foreign" repos hosted elsewhere as part of my build. Hence, I'm not asking for a full SSH-keys solution, as is common with other CI services. Just something that works internally with Bitbucket would be acceptable.

That being said, what I'm really after is a way to compose a Pipelines build out of several Mercurial repos, all hosted on Bitbucket; another mechanism than Mercurial subrepos would do fine, as well.
fields.summary: Support for Mercurial subrepos in Pipelines

fields.description:
I'm sure maven builds are very common in Bitbucket Pipeline builds. As such, I think it would be worthwhile to separate the maven phases in the log output, as we always waste our entire "view in browser" portion of a build output log with just the downloading artifacts part of maven...

for example:

{code}

+ mvn clean install
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
Downloading: http://...nexus/content/groups/public/ca/nanometrics/maven/common-pom-java8/8.0.6/common-pom-java8-8.0.6.pom
614/614 B   
            
Downloaded: http://.../nexus/content/groups/public/ca/nanometrics/maven/common-pom-java8/8.0.6/common-pom-java8-8.0.6.pom (614 B at 0.8 KB/sec)
Downloading: http://.../nexus/content/groups/public/ca/nanometrics/maven/common-pom/8.0.6/common-pom-8.0.6.pom
2/4 KB      
3/4 KB   
4/4 KB   
         
Downloaded: http://.../nexus/content/groups/public/ca/nanometrics/maven/common-pom/8.0.6/common-pom-8.0.6.pom (4 KB at 11.6 KB/sec)
...
{code}

At the very least, collapse this normal part of maven that creates a lot of logs, and even better, separate each phase of the Maven build with its own section in the log "tree" that gets built.  Presumably, this would mean we could expand each section and not have to download the raw log each time we want to take a quick look.
fields.summary: Intelligently group maven phases in log output

fields.description:
Next image is used as default for .NET Core:

{code}
#!yml

image: microsoft/dotnet:onbuild
{code}

But cause I need Windows Containers image, I am trying to change image to "windowsservercore". Based on information in[ microsoft/dotnet|https://hub.docker.com/r/microsoft/dotnet/] docker hub, I have tried

{code}
#!yml


image: microsoft/dotnet:1.0.0-windowsservercore-core
{code}

and

{code}
#!yml

image: microsoft/dotnet:1.0.0-preview2-windowsservercore-sdk 
{code}

but image has not been downloaded:

{code}
#!nlog

docker pull "microsoft/dotnet:1.0.0-windowsservercore-core"
1.0.0-windowsservercore-core: Pulling from microsoft/dotnet
1239394e5a8a: Pulling fs layer
d90a2ac79ff2: Pulling fs layer
cde3fa87b2c9: Pulling fs layer
9f60be4f8205: Pulling fs layer
c4f6347ed968: Pulling fs layer
9f60be4f8205: Waiting
c4f6347ed968: Waiting
1239394e5a8a: Retrying in 5 seconds
d90a2ac79ff2: Verifying Checksum
d90a2ac79ff2: Download complete
cde3fa87b2c9: Verifying Checksum
cde3fa87b2c9: Download complete
1239394e5a8a: Retrying in 4 seconds
c4f6347ed968: Verifying Checksum
c4f6347ed968: Download complete
...
1239394e5a8a: Retrying in 3 seconds
1239394e5a8a: Retrying in 2 seconds
1239394e5a8a: Retrying in 1 second
1239394e5a8a: Downloading
unknown blob
{code}

The following may help:

Based on [this SO question |http://stackoverflow.com/q/38813833/2833802] the following issue in dotnet-docker has been created: [Can't pull microsoft/dotnet:1.0.0-windowsservercore-core |https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-docker/issues/92]
fields.summary: No useful error message when specifying a windowsservercore docker image

fields.description:
Hi,
 We would like to ensure the accounts in Bitbucket Cloud team are created using corporate email address.
 As an administrator of my team, I should be able to view email ids of my team members along with their username & display name and last login time/date.
 Currently it is not possible to view email ids of the team members.

 

Edit by [~tboudale]:

Workspace admins can now view emails of users in workspace *Settings* >> *User groups* >> after selecting a specific User group

I just wanted to add to this feature request, that it would also be useful to be able to
 - retrieve team member emails via API (for admins)
 - view emails in workspace *Settings* >> *Users on plan*
 - view emails in *Repository settings* >> *User and group access* >> section *Users*
fields.summary: Ability to view and export email address for team members

fields.description:
h1. Current status

We are in the process of integrating with Atlassian's [Admin Hub|https://admin.atlassian.com/] to handle all user and group management across all products in a centralized place. Admin Hub has a feature to export users so Bitbucket will gain this functionality as well.
----
It will be helpful to have the facility to export user list from "users on plan" and "user groups"
fields.summary: Ability to export user list in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
If a repository contains an [.editorconfig|http://editorconfig.org/] file, it would be nice if Bitbucket automatically used those values as defaults for viewing source and diffs and in the online editor.

This was requested as follow-on work from BCLOUD-6207, which added query param support for changing the tab size.

It's also related to BCLOUD-11111 (Configurable tab size setting), in that it might be the best way to support repo-level configurable tab sizes.
fields.summary: Add .editorconfig support to determine defaults for things like tabs vs spaces and tab size

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's is hard for team admin to track users who change their username/email address while managing hundreds of users and modify their permission at a later stage unless they inform the Team Admin.

h3. Suggested Solution
When team member changed their username/email address, team admin will receive a notification about the changes.
fields.summary: Notify team admin when team member change username or email address
Automated issue comments show up as "content: null" in API response (BB-9487)

fields.description:
I want my publish my dotnet package (i.g. dotnet pack) to a NuGet.org or MyGet Feed.\\
That would be a very helpful if such a package manager would be integrated
fields.summary: Integration for NuGet (MyGet) package deployment
The PR diff API endpoint's 301 redirect location should retain query parameters

If you'd try to download it with {{hg clone https://bitbucket.org/lyro/evil/src/8cbfd51}}, you'd get absolutely different revision, most probably it's just the latest code.

Hi  i am not able to connect with Bitbucket . please let me suggest what is exact issue . i am not single person who are facing this problem . our entire team facing same problem.

Thanks

fields.description:
In split diff comparison view for changes, when the longest line of a file is modified to be shorter: The deletions view can be scrolled to the right more than the additions view, at which point the line numbers for the additions view can be scrolled out from the left-side and onto the additions view.  This looks a little wonky.

It may be that this bug occurs for changes to a line that result in it being the longest or for longest line creations or deletions.
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff additions view line numbers column horizontal scroll behavior

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Renaming a repo does not change the commit urls in Recent activity feed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a repo
# Push a commit to it
# Rename the repo
# Go the repo's Overview page, and check Recent Activity
# Click the URL of the commit shown there

h3. Expected Results
The commit's page opens

h3. Actual Results
A 404 error is shown, because the url includes the old repo name
fields.summary: Renaming a repo does not change the commit urls in Recent activity feed (BB-16201)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creole engine unable to provide the correct link If the name of the folder or file has whitespace.\\
It only parses the first part of the name.

Example:\\
<<file 7d121ff:Manylines of code/Test.txt>>     =>     Manylines (https://bitbucket.org/<Owner>/<reponame>/src/7d121ff/%5BManylines:#cl-code.txt})\\
<<file 7d121ff:Test file.txt>>     =>     Test (https://bitbucket.org/<Owner>/<reponame>/src/7d121ff/%5BTest:#cl-code.txt})

Syntax given in documentation:\\
<<file path/to/file revision linenumber>>\\
or\\
<<file revison:path/to/file#linenumber>>

{code}

{code}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Macro+Reference+for+Creole+Markup

###Steps to Reproduce

# Insert *<<file Manylines of code/Test.txt>>*
# Select *Creole* Language
# Click *Preview*

###Expected Results\\
Display:\\
*Manylines*

Redirected Link:\\
*https://bitbucket.org/<Owner>/<reponame>/src/7d121ff/%5BManylines:#cl-code.txt}*

###Actual Results\\
Display:\\
*Manylines of code/Test.txt*

Redirected Link:\\
*https://bitbucket.org/<Owner>/<reponame>/src/7d121ff/%5BManylines%20of%20code/Test.txt:#cl-code.txt}*

###Notes\\
Replaced whitespace with *%20* but redirection doesn't work as it parses as *%2520*
fields.summary: File Macro (for Creole) unable to parses correct URL (BB-16200)
downloads page has spurious whitespace before path to tarball in href attribute

fields.description:
For us the whole point of using Bamboo Cloud and Server was to show build and deployment information in Jira. Without this Pipelines is not a viable alternative as there are several other more mature CI solutions available that would provide better functionality.

* Build status of a commit on a Jira ticket,
* Deployment information on a Jira ticket so testing knows which environments have the commit,
* Support for releasing a public version using Jira Releases.
fields.summary: Pipelines JIRA integration to show build and deployment status

fields.description:
Our team run extensive tests against each branch which take a while to run. It would be cool to run a smaller test suite for in-progress branches, and then only run the full test suite once a PR is raised. This would be a good balance of dev speed and test/merge safety.

Currently we are achieving this in pipelines by [calling|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlaskit/src/dec03e3050483ec11d94171e809199512350c935/build/bin/test.pipelines.js%3Fat%3Dmaster%26fileviewer%3Dfile-view-default] the Bitbucket REST API to see if a PR is open for the relevant branch, however this is not 100% reliable because if the PR is raised while the commit build is running then the "full" test suite will never be triggered.
fields.summary: Pipelines should build on PR creation

fields.description:
*A* Steps to recreate assumes:

# You have a local git project.
# This project hasn't been uploaded to Bitbucket yet.
# It has a valid bitbucket-pipelines.yml file in root directory.

*B* Steps to recreate:

# Create repo on Bitbucket.
# Add remote to local git repo.
# Run {{git push --set-upstream origin master}}.
# Goto Pipelines (figure 2) and it doesn't build[^err101] and wants to run through pipelines setup[^err102].
# On the next push, pipelines will run.

*C* Workaround:

Easy. Don't have your initial push with a bitbucket-pipelines.yml file.

References

[^err101]: Error: Pipelines should recognize the valid bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and run on initial push.

[^err102]: Error: While this may be a repercussion from the first error[^err101]. Pipelines should recognize the valid bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and not prompt the initial setup of bitbucket-pipelines.yml file[^fig2]. The only way to bypass this initial setup prompt is to choose a language, press "copy configuration", and click "continue". Prompts with overwriting the pipelines file (see figure 3[^fig3]), ignore overwriting.  Now you go back to pipelines and you've reached figure 4[^fig4] and don't have the pipelines setup block.

[^fig1]: Figure 1.png attachment: Empty repo, all is good.\\
[^fig2]: Figure 2.png attachment: Pipelines blocked with initial setup, even though bitbucket-pipelines.yml is setup.\\
[^fig3]: Figure 3.png attachment: After completing prompt in figure 2[^fig2]. Ignore recreating the file.\\
[^fig4]: Figure 4.png attachment: Back at pipelines
fields.summary: Pipelines should build on initial push

Hello,

Recently we are facing issues with webhooks. It looks like bitbucket is not sending webhooks.\\

This is critical for us.\\
Please check what could be the problem.

Thanks

Please check what could be the problem, thanks, Matej
